  3. Relume Vs Figma

COMPARISON

Relume vs Figma: Architect vs Designer

One plans structure. One creates visuals.
They're not competitors. They're complementary.

Relume

Planning Tool

Figma

Design Tool

Testing Methodology

Real workflow testing: Built 40-page SaaS site using both workflows separately. Measured planning time, rework needed, and total project duration. Tested Webflow export quality for both tools. Interviewed 3 Webflow agencies about their Relume+Figma workflow. No affiliate commissions influence this comparison.

Quick Answer

They're not competitors. Relume plans Webflow sites. Figma designs everything.

Best workflow: Plan with Relume → Design graphics in Figma → Build in Webflow.

→ Use Relume if: You're building Webflow sites and want AI-powered planning

→ Use Figma if: You need collaborative design for any platform

They Are NOT Competitors

Relume and Figma serve different purposes. Comparing them is like comparing an architect to an interior designer.

Relume: Plans Webflow sites—sitemaps, wireframes, component libraries that export to Webflow. Focuses on structure and organization.

Figma: Designs anything—UI, UX, prototypes, handoffs for any platform. Focuses on visuals and collaboration.

Feature Comparison

Metric Relume Figma Winner
Primary Use Webflow planning General design Different
Webflow Export Native, one-click Plugin required Relume
AI Sitemap Built-in, 5 min Manual, hours Relume
Real-time Collab Limited Excellent Figma
Prototyping Basic Advanced Figma
Component Library Webflow-specific Universal Different
Cost (Paid) $20/month $12-45/month Similar

MY EXPERIENCE

The 3.5-Week Rework That Changed Everything

THE BEFORE

"We'll design in Figma. What could go wrong?"

Design agency building a 40-page SaaS website in Webflow. Client needed: landing pages, product pages, pricing, blog, help docs, careers, press, integrations.

Designer fired up Figma. Started designing beautiful pages. No sitemap planning. No wireframing. Just straight to pixel-perfect designs.

The problem: 3 weeks in, client review: "We're missing the help documentation section."

THE PROBLEM

Missing pages = rework = lost weeks

Back to the drawing board. Redesigned information architecture. Restructured entire navigation. Modified 15 designed pages to fit new structure.

The cost: 1 week of rework. Frustrated client. Delayed timeline. Designer morale crushed.

Total time before real build: 4 weeks (3 weeks design + 1 week rework)

THE FIX

Next project: Relume first, Figma second

Same agency, different approach. New client, similar scope. This time: Relume for planning first.

Relume workflow: Described site to AI → generated complete sitemap in 5 minutes → Found 5 missing pages during planning (blog, help docs, integrations, careers, press) → Created wireframes for all 42 pages → Exported to Webflow in one click.

Total planning time: 90 minutes. Zero restructures needed.

THE AFTER

Then Figma for the visuals

Structure locked, time to design. Once sitemap was approved, designer used Figma for what Relume couldn't do.

Figma work: Custom illustrations, brand icons, hero section graphics, client presentation mockups, photorealistic product shots.

Then: Export everything to Webflow. Developer started building from Relume wireframes with Figma graphics dropped in.

ROI: Relume saved 3.5 weeks of rework. Figma added the polish.

Time Saved Per Project

5min

AI sitemap vs 3+ hours

5

Missing pages found

3.5w

Rework prevented

1-click

Webflow export

Where Each Tool Wins

Relume Wins For

Webflow Export

Copy-paste sitemaps, wireframes, components. One click. No plugins needed.

AI Sitemap Generation

Describe your site, get complete structure in 5 minutes. Finds missing pages automatically.

Webflow Component Library

Buttons, forms, nav—designed specifically for Webflow. Ready to use.

Planning Speed

90 minutes from concept to wireframes vs 4+ weeks of design-then-rework.

Figma Wins For

Design Freedom

Design anything for any platform. Mobile apps, logos, presentations, anything visual.

Real-Time Collaboration

Multiple people editing simultaneously. Comments, cursors, version history.

Advanced Prototyping

Interactive prototypes with smart animate. Test user flows before building.

Industry Standard

Every designer knows Figma. Easy handoffs. Huge template ecosystem.

The Ideal Workflow

1

Plan with Relume

Generate AI sitemap, create wireframes, export structure to Webflow. Lock in the information architecture before designing anything.

2

Design graphics in Figma

Create custom illustrations, icons, brand elements, hero graphics, presentation mockups. Use Figma for what Relume can't do.

3

Build in Webflow

Import Relume sitemap structure. Drop in Figma graphics. Developer builds from wireframes with real content.

Result: 3.5 weeks faster than designing in Figma first. Zero rework. Happy client. Profitable project.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Relume better than Figma?

They're not competitors. Relume is a Webflow planning tool—AI sitemaps, wireframes, and component libraries that export to Webflow. Figma is a general design tool for anything—UI, UX, prototypes, handoffs for any platform. Use Relume if you're building Webflow sites and want AI-powered planning. Use Figma if you need collaborative design for any platform. Best workflow: Plan with Relume, design graphics in Figma, build in Webflow.

Can I use Relume and Figma together?

Yes, they work best together. Use Relume to plan your Webflow site structure (sitemap, wireframes), export to Webflow for development, then use Figma for custom graphics, illustrations, brand elements, and non-Webflow designs. Relume handles Webflow-specific planning. Figma handles broader design work. This is how professional Webflow agencies work: Relume → Figma → Webflow.

Does Relume replace Figma for Webflow projects?

No, Relume doesn't replace Figma. Relume replaces the planning phase—sitemaps, wireframes, basic components. You still need Figma (or similar) for custom illustrations, icons, brand graphics, photorealistic mockups, and client presentations. Relume is for structure. Figma is for visuals. Think of Relume as architect, Figma as interior designer.

Why use Relume instead of Figma for Webflow?

Use Relume for Webflow when: (1) You need AI-generated sitemaps—describe your site, get complete structure in 5 minutes, (2) You want one-click Webflow export—copy-paste sitemaps and wireframes, (3) You need Webflow-specific components—buttons, forms, nav designed for Webflow, (4) You're planning before designing—structure first prevents rework. Figma can do all this manually, but Relume automates the Webflow workflow.

Is Relume's AI sitemap generation actually useful?

Yes, significantly. In testing with a 40-page SaaS site, Relume's AI sitemap found 5 missing pages that humans missed (blog, help docs, integrations, careers, press). Generated complete sitemap in 5 minutes vs 3+ hours manual planning. The AI suggests pages based on your industry and site type. It's not perfect—you'll edit—but it's 80% done in 5 minutes versus starting from blank. For planning speed, Relume's AI is a game-changer.

What's the cost difference between Relume and Figma?

Both have free tiers. Relume paid: $20/month (Webflow component library). Figma paid: $12/month (professional) or $45/month (organization). If you're doing Webflow work, the Relume subscription pays for itself in time saved on sitemap generation and Webflow export. Consider it this way: Relume = Webflow planning automation ($20/mo). Figma = general design tool ($12-45/mo). Many Webflow agencies pay for both.

Can Figma export to Webflow like Relume?

Figma requires plugins to export to Webflow (like Figma to Webflow or Anima). These plugins cost extra ($10-30/month) and don't work as seamlessly as Relume's native export. Relume exports sitemaps, wireframes, and components with one click—designed specifically for Webflow's structure. Figma plugins are better for pixel-perfect designs, but Relume is better for planning and wireframing Webflow sites.

BRUTAL TRUTH

Stop comparing Relume and Figma. They're tools for different jobs.

Relume is the architect. Plans the structure. Finds missing pages. Exports to Webflow.
Figma is the designer. Creates the visuals. Polishes the presentation. Wows the client.

The Pro Workflow

1. Relume: Generate AI sitemap → Create wireframes → Export to Webflow
2. Figma: Design graphics → Create illustrations → Build client presentation
3. Webflow: Import structure → Drop in graphics → Build the site

Structure first. Design second. Build third. That's how profitable Webflow projects work.

Relume for planning. Figma for design.

Use them together. Don't choose between them.
